Mumps_1:
Description 1:
    A 25-year-old male patient presented with a fever of 102°F, accompanied by a persistent and severe headache. The patient reported muscle aches and generalized tiredness, rating his overall discomfort at 7/10. Notably, he expressed a reduced appetite and reluctance to eat. On examination, there was noticeable swelling of the parotid glands on both sides of his face, associated with tenderness and pain rated at 5/10. The patient's medical history revealed no recent vaccinations, but he reported close contact with an individual exhibiting mumps symptoms. These contextual factors significantly raise the index of suspicion for mumps, prompting further diagnostic evaluation.
Mumps_2:
Description 2:
    A 30-year-old female patient presented with a 4-day history of fever, documented at 101.5°F, along with moderate to severe headache and muscle aches. She reported a persistent tiredness and generalized malaise. The patient acknowledged a complete loss of appetite and an aversion to eating. On examination, there was evident swelling of the left parotid gland, associated with marked tenderness and localized pain rated at 6/10. Notably, she also exhibited swelling in the submandibular glands, further complicating her ability to eat and drink comfortably. The patient's medical history indicated no recent mumps vaccination, but she had been in recent contact with a mumps-affected individual, elevating the concern for mumps infection.
Mumps_3:
Description 3:
    A 22-year-old male patient presented with a 2-day history of fever, peaking at 103°F, accompanied by a severe, throbbing headache and pronounced muscle pains, which he rated at 8/10 in intensity. He described an overwhelming sense of tiredness and generalized body aches. The patient's appetite was significantly diminished, and he expressed aversion to eating due to the discomfort associated with swallowing. On examination, there was bilateral swelling of the parotid glands, with marked tenderness and pain rated at 7/10. Additionally, the patient complained of stomach pain. Notably, he had experienced recent exposure to mumps, heightening the suspicion of mumps infection as the underlying cause of his symptoms.
